list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a bar or series of bars, typically fixed on upright supports, serving as part of a fence or barrier or used to hang things on.
a steel bar or continuous line of bars laid on the ground as one of a pair forming a railroad track.
the edge of a surfboard or sailboard.
a horizontal piece in the frame of a paneled door or sash window.
a conductor which is maintained at a fixed potential and to which other parts of a circuit are connected.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: the anode must be connected to the positive supply rail
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Anode phải được kết nối với đường sắt cung cấp tích cực

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a secretive bird with drab gray and brown plumage, typically having a long bill and found in dense waterside vegetation.
provide or enclose (a space or place) with a rail or rails.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: the altar is railed off from the nave
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Bàn thờ được lan ra từ Nave

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: (in windsurfing) sail the board on its edge, so that it is at a sharp angle to the surface of the water.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: the more you pull down on the boom, the more you rail
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: bạn càng kéo xuống bùng nổ, bạn càng nhiều đường sắt

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: complain or protest strongly and persistently about.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Anh ấy đã rời rạc với sự nhanh nhẹn của con người
